hints.content: When we try substitution, we do not obtain the indeterminate form $\frac{0}{0}\,$.  Thus we can calculate the limit with direct substitution.

Direct substitution produces the following result.

$\qquad\displaystyle\lim_{x\to 1}{\mathop{}}\,\frac{x^2-3x}{x^2+x+1}=\dfrac{(1)^2-3(1)}{(1)^2+1+1}=\dfrac{1-3}{3}=-\dfrac{2}{3}$
